results.title: Legend of the seven golden vampires
results.creator_credit: Roy Baker, Don Houghton, Vee King Shaw, Hammer and Shaw Production
results.brief_description: Hammer Horror meets martial arts mayhem in “The Legend of the seven golden vampires,” allegedly the first kung-fu horror film co-produced entirely on location in Hong Kong. This action-packed and bloodthirsty tale of vengeance and family honour begins in nineteenth century Transylvania, where Kah, High Priest of the Seven Golden Vampires, abases himself before the mouldering tomb of Dracula, and begs him to resurrect his vampires - sleeping after a brave farmer dares to kill one of them - so that his temple in the remote village of Ping Kwei may become a site of power once again. However, Dracula, being the sinister creature he is, seizes the opportunity to do more than assist… Exactly one hundred years later, Dr. Van Helsing attempts to convince Chinese academics from Chunking University to help him locate the village to uncover the six remaining vampires. After suffering their scorn, he resolves to leave Chunking, only to be confronted by a man claiming to be the ancestor of the farmer who had killed the seventh vampire. Hsi Ching reveals that Van Helsing and his foppish son Leyland have been under the exclusive protection of his family since coming to China, and provides the Professor with proof of his connection to the vampire legend. After the wealthy and adventurous widow Vanessa Buren offers to finance the risky venture, Van Helsing agrees to lead an expedition to Ping Kwei to rid the village of its vampire curse. But the forces of evil are stronger than they anticipate, and it takes all the martial arts skill of Ching’s siblings combined with Van Helsing’s vampire-vanquishing experience to defeat the remaining vampires and legions of undead sent to stop them before it is too late. The vampires in this film are very Westernised and quite different to the more well known “hopping vampires” found in later films such as Encounters of the spooky kind (1980) and Mr. Vampire (1985). Stars Peter Cushing as Van Helsing, Chan Shen as Kah, David Chiang as Hsi Ching, Julie Ege as Vanessa Buren, and Shi Szu as Mei Kwei. In English with some subtitles.

results.title: Gone in 60 seconds = Gone in sixty seconds
results.creator_credit: Dominic Sena, Jerry Bruckheimer, Mike Stenson and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: In this remake of H. B. Halicki’s cult favourite, Nicholas Cage stars as Randall “Memphis” Raines, a master car thief whose desire to get out of the game is compromised when his brother becomes embroiled with a dangerous criminal. To save his brother Memphis must steal fifty cars in one evening, a task he undertakes with the aid of a motley crew. At the same time, another gang is undertaking the same challenge and the police are hot on the trail of both. Cast also includes Angelina Jolie, Giovanni Ribisi, Will Patton, Robert Duvall.

results.title: Mackenna's gold
results.creator_credit: J Thompson, Carl Foreman, Dimitri Tiomkin and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A dying Indian entrusts sherrif Mackenna (Gregory Peck) with a map of the legendary Valley of Gold. After memorising the contents of the map Mackenna destroys it, thus placing himself in a precarious position of being a target to the local bandit gang as well as the townspeople. The two parties are united by a greed for gold and a fear of the common enemy, the Apaches. The gold in the canyon belongs to the Apaches and it has been decreed by Apache Gods that the gold remain untouched. Both those who are hunting the gold, and the Apaches who are protecting it have their own reasons behind desiring its possession, leading to a violent climax. Cast includes Gregory Peck, Omar Sharif, Telly Savalas, Burgess Meredith and Edward G Robinson. Also included on the tape are original theatrical trailers and behind the scenes information.

results.title: Kirikou and the sorceress [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michel Ocelot, Didier Brunner, Jacques Vercruyssen, Paul Thiltges, France 3 Cinema, Les Armateurs, Monipoly Productions and Odec Kid Cartoons
results.brief_description: A delightful animated fable, “Kirikou and the sorceress” starts with a child, Kirikou, speaking to his mother from the womb. Once born, Kirikou seeks about healing his village - principally from the curse that an ill-tempered sorceress has placed on the village including drying up the wells and eating up the men-folk. In his bid to confront the sorceress and see the end to his tribe’s woes, Kirikou undertakes a perilous journey meeting an array of colourful beings and jungle creatures. The charm of the narrative is that it presents from a child’s perspective with uncomplicated views on life, unsullied by conjecture and misguided beliefs. The African village where this whimsical tale is set is abundant with colour, humour, culture and magic, with animation inspired by the earth colours and myths of Africa and imbued with a rich palette reminiscent of 19th century French painter Henri Rousseau. Music scored by Senegalese musician Youssou N’dour.

results.title: The Secret of Nimh 2: Timmy to the rescue
results.creator_credit: Dick Sebast, Jonathan Dern, Paul Sabella and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Jonathan Brisby, the bravest of all rats died in saving his fellow creatures from the evil clutches of NIMH. Once escaped, the rats made a home for themselves in Thorn Valley. It was predicted that one day the forces of NIMH would rise again and the son of Jonathan Brisby would save them; the destiny of rats lies with Timmy Brisby. Feeling the pressure to be the hero his father was, Timmy begins his journey with Jeremy the crow where he is placed under the tutelage of Mr Ages and fellow elders who equip him with the tools to face his destiny. A female rat called Jenny makes it to the village and implores them to return to NIMH with her and save the rats from the evil Doctor Valentine. The council decides against helping her however, and when Timmy discovers elder brother Martin is a prisoner at NIMH, he and Jenny decide to save the rats themselves. Made for television 16 years after the original and features musical numbers. Features the voices of Dom DeLuise, Eric Idle, Ralph Macchio, William H. Macy and Hynden Walch. Narrated by Peter MacNicoll.

results.title: Happy Gilmore
results.creator_credit: Dennis Dugan, Robert Simonds, MCA/Universal and MCA/Universal Home Video
results.brief_description: Happy Gilmore has an anger management problem, which could be really helpful if he could achieve his dream of becoming a professional ice hockey player. However he is a lousy skater. When his beloved grandmother loses her home to the IRS he desperately tries to find a way to raise the money. Quite by accident he discovers that his hockey slap shot translates to an amazingly accurate 400 yard golf tee shot. So he decides to join the pro golf tour, brining his ferocious temper and outlandish antics to the well-tended fairways. Before long he is a media sensation, attracting hordes of followers and news cameras wherever he goes. A rivalry between Happy and nasty golf pro ‘Shooter’ heats up, resulting in a riotous confrontation on the once-hallowed golf links.

results.title: Joe Dirt
results.creator_credit: Dennie Gordon, Robert Simonds, Columbia Pictures and Happy Madison Productions
results.brief_description: Joe Dirt (David Spade) is a janitor, has a ‘mullet’ hairstyle and is the butt of many jokes in the building where he works. Abandoned as a child at the Grand Canyon by his birth parents, Joe is raised by foster parents, until he makes the decision to find his family and ask them why they left him behind. When he is discovered by a radio DJ (Dennis Miller) in Los Angeles, Joe goes live on air and shares the adventures he had while searching for his parents with the listeners, captivating the entire city. Cast also includes Christopher Walken, Brittany Daniel, Kid Rock and Jaime Pressley.

results.title: Gladiator [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Branko Lustig, David Franzoni, Douglas Wick, NBCUniversal and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Russell Crowe stars as Maximus, a former general accused of murdering Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius. Maximus is forced to become a gladiator, and uses his newfound fame and power to extract revenge.

constellations_other.name: Swords, sandals and lightning bolts
constellations_other.description: In Thor: Love and Thunder, Russell Crowe plays one of the most recogniseable gods in the pantheon – Zeus. His scenes lampoon his Oscar-winning role in Gladiator, one of the most recognised films in a classic genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Ridley Scott, Branko Lustig, David Franzoni, Douglas Wick, NBCUniversal and Universal Pictures
results.description: Following the suspicious death of Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, his newly named successor, Maximus (Russell Crowe) - the former emperor’s key advisor and most loyal general, is accused of his murder, leaving Marcus’ scheming son, Commodus (Joaquin Phoenix) to take over the throne. As a result of his accusation, Maximus is stripped of his title and position in the army and sold to slave traders, forced to become a gladiator - men trained to fight to the death as entertainment for a paying audience. Using his new fame and power he vows to fight the man responsible for his dishonour. Includes the making of documentary. Cast also includes Connie Nielsen, Derek Jacobi, Richard Harris and Oliver Reed in his final screen role (Reed died before the movie was completed). Awards: winner of 5 Academy Awards including Best Actor (Russell Crowe) and Best Film (2000).

results.title: The Mask of Zorro
results.creator_credit: Martin Campbell, David Fister, Doug Claybourne and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: From the director of “Goldeneye” comes this swashbuckling action-packed blockbuster starring Anthony Hopkins, Antonio Banderas and Catherine Zeta Jones. Zorro -legendary name conjures up images of masks, sword fights and one man’s fight for justice. Or is it just one man? Set in California when it’s still controlled from Spain by the Mexican authorities, one man (Anthony Hopkins) fights against injustice for the ordinary man in the only way he can - as a masked phantom. What happens when his world is turned upside down? Does the legend continue and how is this possible? These questions and others are answered as the story unfolds.

results.title: Mystery, Alaska
results.creator_credit: Jay Roach, David E. Kelley, Howard Baldwin and Buena Vista
results.brief_description: Mystery, Alaska is a small town where all the men in the community are obsessed with ice-hockey. They have their own competitive league which becomes the attention of a national sports magazine, this leads to someone at the National Hockey League coming up with an idea for an amazing publicity stunt. The New York Rangers are on their way to Mystery to play the local boys in an ice-hockey match. The town goes crazy with excitement, although there a few who that don’t see this as a good idea, more like an opportunity to embarrass their close knit community.
